column1: Sriramnagar is a census town in Vizianagaram district of the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh. It is located in Garividi mandal of Vizianagaram revenue division.

column3: 550. Males constitute 50% of the population and females 50%. Sriramnagar has an average literacy rate of 64%
column4: higher than the national average of 59.5%: male literacy is 73%
column5: and female literacy is 56%. In Sriramnagar
column6: 11% of the population is under 6 years of age.

column1: The primary and secondary school education is imparted by government
column3: under the School Education Department of the state. The medium of instruction followed by different schools are English
